intro: Angelica anomala var. kawakamii, commonly known as Kawakamii angelica, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streamside areas. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
